title: Disgraced FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried 'orchestrated yearslong fraud' on investors and customers, SEC and criminal charges say
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the former CEO of cryptocurrency giant FTX, defrauded investors by funneling money into his private hedge fund and conspired to commit wire fraud against his customers and lenders, according to criminal charges filed in New York and charges by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Elon Musk says he can stop child exploitation on Twitter. So far, he’s axed jobs and pushed out watchdogs.
description: Less than a month after taking control of Twitter, Elon Musk said addressing child sexual exploitation content on the social media platform was “Priority #1.” B

title: Blacklisted Russian propagandists thrive on right-wing apps Gab and Truth Social, study finds
description: A study finds some of Russia's most notorious propagandists, blocked mainly on Twitter and Facebook, have resurrected themselves on under-moderated social media apps.

title: Lawmakers unveil bipartisan bill to ban TikTok nationwide
description: A group of lawmakers introduced a bill that would ban TikTok in the U.S. after warnings from the FBI that China could use the social media platform for spying.

title: We have 'ignition': Fusion breakthrough draws energy gain
description: U.S. scientists have achieved “ignition” —  a fusion reaction that produced more energy than it took to create — a critical milestone for nuclear fusion.

title: Twitter disbands its Trust and Safety Council
description: Twitter on Monday disbanded its Trust and Safety Council, a group of volunteers who offered the company outside expert advice about online safety, according to
